answers.answer: I'm 31 weeks and never had it done except for when they were checking for a uti. So don't worry
I have to pee in a cup every visit. I'd ask your doctor why they don't. What if you had an infection or something? Seems strange to me

I was thinking the same thing I did have a bacterial infection which I told them I thought I had one she literary gave my a cotton swab and told me to go to the bathroom and swab myself very strange I thought. Which indeed I did have the bacterial infection which I got antibiotics for.
My doctor has never done it besides my first visit, and I'm now 34 weeks. I was wondering the same thing!
I pee in a cup at every doctor appt.
I didn't have to pee in a cup unless I thought i had an infection. Different  drs do different things.
I had to do it recently. it's for pregnant women with high blood pressure at risk for preeclampsia to check for protein in urine
Every single visit the first thing I do is pee in a cup. I'm 30 weeks and they did the same with my first. I thought it was just normal routine for every visit.
Every Dr or midwife I ever seen tested urine at every visit.
I only took a urine test twice my entire pregnancy...one at my first visit and one at 36 weeks..

Agree with @kward2  it's not for after you have had high blood pressure. It's routine usually because it's to keep check for utis which can cause preterm labor. And to watch for protein which can be a sign of preeclampsia.
I pee in a cup every doctors visit... Seems strange that a lot of ladies don't

question: I hear everybody saying their doctor checks their urine for protein and salt or maybe it's sugar im a ftm and have never had that done is that normal? I only peed in a cup my very first time at the doctor office! Anybody else not have it done?
title: lost for info
